creator: azureskyblazer@yahoo.co.in
text:
jmeter hangs up when i try to use the gui to open a .jmx file for testing. but
when i try the same specifying the -t switch followed by then jmx file, then
jmeter opens up displaying the test file. but if i use the gui to open a file it
jus hangs up. i found a way to use the gui to open up the file. i go to
options->look and feel->CDE/Motif n then try to open a file using the file
browser then jmeter allows a jmx file to be opened. after i open the jmx file i
go back and change the look n feel to windows or metal then the file browser
continues to function but in CDE/Motif. currently i m jus creating .bat files
with -t switches as a workaround.


******************************************************************************
2006/10/06 11:48:18 WARN  - jmeter.gui.util.MenuFactory: Missing jar? Could not
create org.apache.jmeter.visualizers.MailerVisualizer.
java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: javax/mail/MessagingException 
2006/10/06 11:48:18 INFO  - jmeter.samplers.SampleResult: Note: Sample
TimeStamps are START times 
2006/10/06 11:48:18 INFO  - jmeter.samplers.SampleResult:
sampleresult.default.encoding is set to ISO-8859-1

creator: sebb@apache.org
text:
Does this happen with all JMX files?

Any messages in jmeter.log or in the DOS console when it hangs?

[By the way, you can drop a JMX file on jmeter-t.bat and it will open the 
file.]
